comments:
When I try to debug an application using Eclipse, I see the following happening:

1. Launching XXX

2. Finding Free socket

3. Establishing debug connection...

4. javaw.exe has encountered a problem and needs to close. We are sorry for the 
inconvenience.

5. Exception ocurred during launch
Reason: Cannot connect to the VM

I have tried switching between Eclipse 2.1, and Eclipse 3.0 M1, and that has 
not helped. I have tried the following JDK versions : JDK 1.3.1_06, JDK 
1.3.1_08 and that has not helped either. 

I've also updated my Windows installation with the latest quick fixes/updates.

The details I get from Windows are as follows :

AppName: javaw.exe	 AppVer: 0.0.0.0	 ModName: s5spi.dll
odVer: 4.2.0.0	 Offset: 00005c1a

Here are the contents of appcompat.txt :

This sounds like a TCP configuration problem. See bug 31786 and bug 27654. Can 
you manually launch a java program in debug mode and connect with a "Remote 
Java Application" launch configuration?
Closing without more info/steps to reproduce.

Reopening this bugzilla since got a customer that encounters this problem as
well, and it is reproducible (on his machine... ):
"Cannot debug large applications in WSAD 5.1.0. Debuger halts with  
error message: Exception during launch. Reason: Cannot connect to VM.   This
started happening only after installing Permeo. (SOCKS application Permeo
(www.permeo.com))
The problem occurs when we add projects with large number of jar files 
to the build path. (About 95 jarfiles.) Small applications can be debugged
without problem."

Here is his stack trace:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

 I asked him to try your suggestion from Comment #1 and here is the response:
"... I have tested to run the application outside of WSAD, and then connect the
WSAD debugger remotely to the application. It worked fine. I don't get the WSAD
error dialog."

Any suggestions on how to further debug this problem?

Does permeo have settings that restrict port usage? Sounds like it could be a 
firewall problem (i.e. blocked ports).
Adding as CC for last comment.

My problem's gone away after uninstalling the SocksCap library (from Permeo). 
If I get a chance to play around with another virgin PC, I will install 
SocksCap there to see if the problems comes back.

"I have been in contact with Permeo support to see if they can help me configure
a workaround for the problem. But after several attempts, I still have not found
a way to configure around the problem. 
What I have got from Permeo support as a temporary solution, is two commands to
disable/enable Permeo. (I execute the spi_inst.exe with different flags.)"

Hence Eclipse help is still needed ...

The only thing the Java debugger could do is offer the user a chance to 
specify a port# to use (if there are ports that the Permeo tool allowed us to 
use). This feature request has already been logged as bug 40657 but is 
currently deferred.

I'm closing this bug again, as this is really a problem with the Permeo tool, 
with a noted workaround.
